title: Kraken

properties.value: The Kraken is a stronger and larger version of the cave kraken. It requires level 87 Slayer to kill and cannot be boosted. content:
This article is about the boss variant of Cave kraken. For the normal Slayer monster, see Cave kraken.
 This article has a strategy guide here.
All information on mechanics and strategy will be on this page.
This article has a money making guide: Killing the Kraken.
Please add tips to the subpage, rather than the article below.
You have the option to create a private instance for this fight.
On death, all unprotected items will be moved to a grave outside the instance. Any items left on the ground will be lost.

The Kraken is a stronger and larger version of the cave kraken. It requires level 87 Slayer to kill and cannot be boosted. Located at the Kraken Cove, it can only be attacked if the player has cave krakens as a Slayer task, which also requires level 50 Magic. Alongside its non-boss variants, it is the only monster that drops the trident of the seas and Kraken tentacle.

Like its smaller brethren, the Kraken is submerged underwater. Magic is the only reliable way of dealing damage to it, as Ranged attacks are heavily reduced, and Melee cannot be used. To start the fight, players can use a fishing explosive on the large whirlpool. Alternatively, the four whirlpools around can be disturbed; when all four whirlpools are disturbed, the larger one can be disturbed, which will result in the Kraken waking up. Both methods will release level 112 Enormous Tentacles, which attack with Magic.

Both the Kraken and its tentacles attack with magic; the Kraken can hit very hard, but often misses, while the tentacles are much more accurate but deal less damage. The Kraken and its tentacles use Typeless Magic and as such Protect from Magic does not provide any degree of damage reduction. The Kraken's projectile resembles Fire Wave.

Players can create a Kraken instance for 25,000 coins. This fee can be deducted directly from the bank; players do not need to carry coins on them to create the instance.

Drops[edit | edit source]

Drop rates estimated based on 437,585 kills from the Drop Rate Project, unless otherwise cited.

The average Kraken kill is worth 21,219.6.

The average Kraken kill while on a Konar task is worth 23,581.78.

Combat Achievements[edit | edit source]

The following Combat Achievement tasks involve the Kraken.

Name Description Difficulty Category
Kraken Adept Kill the Kraken 20 times. Hard Kill count
Unnecessary Optimization Kill the Kraken after killing all four tentacles. Hard Mechanical
Krakan't Hurt Me Kill the Kraken 25 times in a privately rented instance without leaving the room. Hard Stamina
Ten-tacles Kill the Kraken 50 times in a privately rented instance without leaving the room. Elite Stamina
One Hundred Tentacles Kill the Kraken 100 times in a privately rented instance without leaving the room. Master Stamina

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
14 July 2021
(update | poll)

Fishing explosives can now be used to instantly awaken the Kraken.

23 July 2020
(update)

The Kraken will now correctly attack the player it is engaged in combat with.

24 September 2015
(update)

The Kraken whirlpool can no longer be damaged by poison.

25 June 2015
(update | poll)

Added a 'peek' option to the entrance of this boss, allowing players to see the number of other players currently in the boss room.

19 March 2015
(update | poll)

It is now possible to open an instanced Kraken cave.

17 July 2014
(update | poll)

Players can now receive a pet version of this boss after defeating it.

22 May 2014
(update)

Thermy and the Cave kraken boss now have 'Attack' options, rather than 'Fight'.

24 April 2014
(update)

Kraken now respawns at the same rate as the thermonuclear smoke devil.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The Kraken uses the same in-game model as the Sea Troll Queen from the Swan Song quest, but recoloured.
  • Its examine text, the jar of dirt drop, and the abyssal tentacle are references to Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man's Chest and its sequel At World's End.
  • The kraken had a festive override wearing a santa hat during the 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020, and 2021 Christmas events.
  • The Kraken is a mythological creature originating from Norse folklore.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ 1.0 1.1 1.2 1.3 1.4 1.5 Envision. "Drop Rates V2." Old School RuneScape Forums.
  2. ^ Jagex. Mod JohnC's Twitter account. 15 September 2014. (Archived from the original on 15 September 2014.) Mod JohnC: "Kraken, Thermy & Penance Queen pet drop rates - DKS for the final reveal next week!"
